article:
'Precursor mRNA' ('pre-mRNA') is an immature single strand of messenger
ribonucleic acid (mRNA). pre-mRNA is synthesized from a DNA template in the cell
nucleus by transcription. Pre-mRNA comprises the bulk of 'heterogeneous nuclear
RNA' ('hnRNA'). The term hnRNA is often used as a synonym for pre-mRNA,
although, in the strict sense, hnRNA may include nuclear RNA transcripts that do
not end up as cytoplasmic mRNA.

Once pre-mRNA has been completely processed, it is termed "mature messenger
RNA", "mature mRNA", or simply "mRNA".
